Description: Automatically identifies and extracts binary relationships from English sentences. Relations are lexical, i.e. they consist of a predicate (verb phrase) and its two noun phrase arguments.
Extracts relations among sentences. Relations are lexical, i.e. the consist of a predicate and arguments as in 1.1 and also include lexical information about attribution and the enabling condition.
License: Apache 2.0, MIT, New BSD, http://www.maltparser.org/license.html, In house

Description: Extracts relations between entities in a large document collection. Relations are drawn from an ontology (e.g. attendedSchool).
Identifies coreferences (group of equivalent items) within a document. Coreference is currently performed only for selected Entity types.

Software: Cross Document Coreference with Resolution to Knowledge Base(KB)
Description: Identifies coreferences (group of equivalent items) within a document and resolves the coreferences with a KB. Coreference is currently performed for People and Organizations.

Software: Bayesian Logic Programs for Textual Inference
Description: Infers new relations based on given set of relations and documents. Relations are drawn from an ontology (e.g. attendedSchool).

Software: Labeled N-Ary Relations between Typed Text Spans
Description: Extracts (binary) relations from the document. Relations are drawn from an ontology (e.g. attendedSchool).
License: GPL, LGPL, BSD, Apache, MIT, CPL, SUN

Software: Speech Segmentation (Prosodic Analysis for Anomaly Analysis)
Description: Assigns segmentation at the level of sentences, prosodic phrases or discourse units as an ordered list of start time-end time pairs.

Software: Anomaly Analysis (Prosodic Analysis for Anomaly Analysis)
Description: Annotates speech segment with confidence values denoting how uncertain the speaker is or how novel the information contained in the unit is.

Tags the modality of predicates (verbs) into one of six classes (ability, effort, intention, success, want, belief) and for those of the speaker/author of the text toward each proposition in the text.
License: InHouse, ASL, CPL, EPL, LGPL, GPL, BSD, MIT

Description: Judges whether a sentence is sarcastic or not.
Generates a list of acoustic/prosodic characteristics from the input.
Tags phrases in sentences for subjectivity and polarity.
License: GPL, ASL, Apache,  BSD, In house

Description: Labels interaction events and their participants. There are at least two types: Interaction and Cognition.

Software: Cross Document Co-reference of Relations and Entities
Description: Extracts relations, entities, and co-reference information across a set of documents. Relations are drawn from an ontology (e.g. attendedSchool). The initial focus will be on people and organizations.
Performs coreference of events (verbs and nominalizations). Coreference is typed (i.e. identity, part-of, member-of). Limited set of epistemic values attached to each event.
License: Restricted by a university license that: (a)prohibits further distribution without the new recipient signing the license, (b)prohibits commercialization, and (c)protects the source organization, CMU and USC, from lawsuits.

Description: Assigns either a label or a numerical score of novelty in the input stream.
License: Restricted by a university license that: (a)prohibits further distribution without the new recipient signing the license, (b)prohibits commercialization, and (c)protects the source organization, CMU and USC, from lawsuits.

Software: KB Web, Knowledge Resolver/Event Ontology Creation.htm, Event Ontology Creation
Description: Generates an ontology of possible events. Event is a list of entities, each associated with statistical distribution over associated verbs and subject/object positions relative to verb. Events also include a description of pairwise relationships between entities (e.g., coreferent or other). Per communication with the PI, this algorithm will be delayed.
License: Restricted by a university license that: (a)prohibits further distribution without the new recipient signing the license, (b)prohibits commercialization, and (c)protects the source organization, CMU and USC, from lawsuits.

Software: KB Web, Knowledge Resolver/Knowledge Resolver.htm, Knowledge Resolver
Description: Processes a document and a set of hypotheses to generate the most coherent subset of hypotheses to explain the document.
License: Restricted by a university license that: (a)prohibits further distribution without the new recipient signing the license, (b)prohibits commercialization, and (c)protects the source organization, CMU and USC, from lawsuits.

Software: KB Web, Knowledge Resolver/Knowledge Base Web Service.htm, Knowledge Base(KB) Web Service
Description: Retrieves semantic information about entities, slots, and their values. Also enables inference over the KB to determine confidence, justification, metadata, and relevant text for a given entity-slot pair.
Generates a ranked list of potential paraphrases for the input.
Generates a database of domain-specific paraphrases using the input data.
Identifies entailment relations (entails, contradicts, unrelated, etc.) between pairs of passages.
Identifies entailment relations (entails, contradicts, unrelated, etc.) between pairs of passages or structured hypothesis and passage.
License: Covered by the Illinois/NCSA Academic Use license. This allows individuals to use our software for non-commercial purposes, but restricts commercial use.

Description: Exctracts n-ary relations within the document. Relation set is closer semantic/linguistic relations (e.g. BENEFICIARY, Arg-0).
License: Covered by the Illinois/NCSA Academic Use license. This allows individuals to use our software for non-commercial purposes, but restricts commercial use.

Description: Recognizes relations between events, where events are ESRL predicate/argument structures. Relations include CAUSE/ENABLE, PART-OF.
License: Covered by the Illinois/NCSA Academic Use license. This allows individuals to use our software for non-commercial purposes, but restricts commercial use.

Description: Identifies a coherent set of concepts of interest in a given document, based on entities/concepts in a reference collection(Wikipedia, for now). Links entities in a document to Wikipedia URLs.
License: Covered by the Illinois/NCSA Academic Use license. This allows individuals to use our software for non-commercial purposes, but restricts commercial use.

Description: Assigns part of speech tags to words in the input document.
License: Covered by the Illinois/NCSA Academic Use license. This allows individuals to use our software for non-commercial purposes, but restricts commercial use.

Description: Divides the input documents into shallow parse chunks.
License: Covered by the Illinois/NCSA Academic Use license. This allows individuals to use our software for non-commercial purposes, but restricts commercial use.

Description: Identifies named entities in the input document.
Identifies coreferences in a document for both entities and verbs.
License: Covered by the Illinois/NCSA Academic Use license. This allows individuals to use our software for non-commercial purposes, but restricts commercial use.

Description: Identifies entity mentions in a collection of documents, and generates relevant relational statistics. The relations statisics are in terms of predicate argument structure.
License: Covered by the Illinois/NCSA Academic Use license. This allows individuals to use our software for non-commercial purposes, but restricts commercial use.

Description: Identifies the attitude (positive/negative) of an entity toward other entities within a sentence.
Assigns scores between [0,1] indicating the similarity in meaning between two sentences.
Identifies entailment relation (entails, contradicts, etc.) between a given pair of phrases.
Identifies entity and verb coreferences within the input document.
Calculates the semantic similarity between a pair of input text.

Software: Stanford's Labeled N-Ary Relations between Typed Text Spans (v1- Relation Extraction for KBP-Slot Filling)
Description: Extracts binary relations from a document. Relations are pulled from an ontology (e.g. attended school).

Software: Stanford's Coreference (Cross document with resolution to KB)
Description: Identifies entity coreferences across documents, and updates the KB with new found entities. System was designed for people and organizations.
Identifies and labels entity mentions within a document.

Identifies named entites in text. Can be used with various models. As packaged by default with Stanford CoreNLP, 12 classes are recognized: DATE, TIME, DURATION, SET, NUMBER, ORDINAL, PERSON, LOCATION, ORGANIZATION, MONEY, PERCENT, MISC.
Interfaces and integration framework for DEFT HLT algorithms and components.
User interface and visulization.
